author: bob parks
text: the mobile-computing hype sure has spawned some compact, well-designed digital tools. brother's color portable printer, the mp-21c, is the latest concession to a light load. i've been carrying this 2.2-pound ink-jet number in my backpack, hooking it up via pc-card slot to my laptop and to the parallel port on my pc at work. it churns out vivid color printouts, text docs, and photos - though images fall a bit shy of photographs. the unit doesn't need a power cord; it draws a small amount of juice from your laptop. the setup is easier and the quality comparable to that of canon's bjc-50, another nearly wearable printer (though the canon has an advantage working as a portable scanner, too). laptop peripherals are like legos for adults: with the right combo, you can build yourself a portable office in the back of a cab.mp-21c dx: $349 with paper feeder and power adapter. brother: street credbrother's keepercryptic adventureshave it your wayshout it outkiller opbatman's second lifereality checkrobo scopemusicjust outta betareadmepersonalized checkingdeep knowledge'phone of silencewatts for dinnerthe public face of linuxcontributors
